item.title: Street Cleaning needed in 7, Durham Avenue, 22nd October
item.description:
The whole Durham avenue is filled with fallen leaves which is making difficult to walk. its very slippery. especially near 7, Durham avenue in and around this is very worst and scared if it will cause any issue to pedestrians, especially i see old people walking too. So, please clean this immediately to avoid any issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chiltern Gardens, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ‘ RUBBISH’ dumped in the public footpath end of Fortune Walk at junction with Garrick Drive (SE28 0EL), 22nd October
item.description:
‘ RUBBISH’ dumped in the public footpath end of Fortune Walk at junction with Garrick Drive (SE28 0EL) This an ongoing problem that won’t be resolved until a CCTV camera is planted. Please collect the waste ASAP as the waste is littered everywhere

item.title: Abandoned rubbish van with windows broken, 22nd October
item.description:
Its been more than 5 or 6 weeks i see this van being parked in this parking haphazardly and the front windows broken, tyre punctured. this is carrying rubbish due to which rats do come out and it has already damaged my car for £180. i am unable to park my car within the parking box since the van is interrupting this space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chiltern Gardens, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead cat found, 22nd October
item.description:
The road I live on is a thoroughfare for primary school children so when I discovered a dead cat this morning I put it in a box to shield from sight. It is near the wall opposite 48 Norcroft Gardens. Can you collect please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 300, Friern Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Stolen vehicle with cloned plates, 22nd October
item.description:
Plates belong to a Range Rover! This is a BMW. Been there since Tuesday morning (maybe Monday night) and still there Wednesday morning. Narrow part of road where nobody normally parks. Must be left to see if it has a tracker on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, London

item.title: Bin Bags on George Lane pavement near Le Delice, 22nd October
item.description:
I have reported this on numerous occasions before but someone keeps leaving rubbish bags on the pavement on George Lane next to the Le Delice grundon bin. They are dumped on the street late at night and then the foxes get at the bin bags, leaving rubbish strewn all over the pavement and street. It is a public health issue and needs to be cleaned up ASAP. Preventative action also needs to be taken as this has happened regularly for the past three months in exactly the same spot (likely by the same culprit).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, George Lane, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
